website_summaries.verdict: This compact chainsaw is a good choice for small jobs, but you may want something more powerful for tougher tasks.
pros: Self-oiling machine with translucent oil tank
Small, lightweight machine that you can maneuver with ease
Battery is compatible with other Greenworks tools
cons: Complaints of oil leaking and the chain popping off even after being tightened

customer_reviews.title: beware of plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: this was a waste as the part that holds the bar is PLASTIC! it just fell apart, now I have 3 pieces and the saw is worthless. as for the motor it ran super was cutting great ,but the PLASTIC parts are worthless, guess they don't like to make things from metal anymore. NOTE! I wrote and sent photos to the greenworks company weeks ago , but they never got back to me so take car when you check the products warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks did good.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned dozens of chain saws, and this little guy is my favorite. It makes cutting up trees almost fun. This is a great little saw for cutting hair on trees, and clearing up brush. It also cuts some surprisingly large size logs. The battery last long enough to get a feeling of accomplishment. The self oiling chain, and easy tool-less bar adjustment are nice features. It is much less noisy than a gas saw, and no fumes, or cords to get tangled up. The saw is light enough and small enough to scurry up trees and trim branches. Things are looking alot better around my place since getting this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: this one works beautifully for what I want to cut down
customer_reviews.text: My husband died recently, and he did all of the chain sawing, with a chain saw that was hard to start for him....this one works beautifully for what I want to cut down....I do not plan on cutting down any 40 ft. Trees. It starts right away, and cuts beautifully...I also bought after...a hedge shears which also works great....great for people who are left alone to cope with a yard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: If you need a convenient, easy to use chainsaw, this is for you. I just used it to cut through 8”-10” small trees with ease. The unit is light weight (8-10 lbs with battery) and simple to operate. I would recommend a spare battery if you intend to use the unit for periods longer than one hour BE SURE TO READ THE INSTRUCTIONS!!!! BIN
customer_reviews.author: Bernard N.

customer_reviews.title: I was prepared for oil leaks and am not annoyed by it
customer_reviews.text: I was prepared for oil leaks and am not annoyed by it. I keep the saw level on a piece of corrugated cardboard and the oil stops there. It cuts well, so far plenty of power, but like any lithium ion battery, when it runs down, it stops -- s-t-o-p -- with little or no warning. I was prepared for both these issues from a study of reviews on Amazon.com and happy pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: IraLA

customer_reviews.title: I'm cleaning up a couple acres of pinon pine and juniper with a max diameter of about 7 inches and this saw works great. It's as
customer_reviews.text: I'm not cutting timber for a mill, or cutting cords of firewood for winter heat, so when I saw this opportunity for a basic functional chain saw with no need for gas mixing, or more gas cans to store , I had to try it. I'm cleaning up a couple acres of pinon pine and juniper with a max diameter of about 7 inches and this saw works great. It's as capable as a small gas powered saw, without the noise and the mess. The time between charges is longer than I thought it would be too. Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. It's battery-powered and hasn't run out on me when I've used it, so I just put the battery back on the charger when I'm done. Granted, I'm only cutting a few trees at a time and don't do it all day for a living, but it works for me. It's lightweight and not intimidating like other larger gas-powered saws. I've had trouble with the chain coming off a few times but when I contacted GreenWorks with my questions they were very responsive. That could be user error or the saw, not sure. Make sure you get the chainsaw oil when you order this since you'll need it to use anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about a battery operated chain saw, but this thing really has its uses. It actually cuts bigger stuff better than smaller stuff. Probably because the chain speed is pretty slow. It tends to bounce on stuff 1 inch or less. But it does the job nice and quietly. The battery last longer than I expected. It does consume chain oil faster than a gas saw. Overall its great for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: John K. Skalecki

customer_reviews.title: Having fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to use it, at first, since I am a woman over 70. I love it. It makes cutting a pleasure. And, the battery charges faster than expected. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: azres

customer_reviews.title: The little chainsaw that could
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing a number of options, I purchased the 10" cordless Green Works chainsaw for the removal of 4 backyard pine trees - approx 6-7" in diameter at their thickest and maybe 15 feet tall. This thing worked better than I anticipated and got the entire job done on 1 charge! It has already paid for itself, I couldn't be happier with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken James

customer_reviews.title: Love this little saw
customer_reviews.text: I got this saw yesterday, charged it up in less than an hour, and added some chain lube oil. Today I went to my daughters and cut down some very overgrown bushes. It took me two hours. The charge was pretty near depleted when I finished. As a senior citizen this saw was just what I needed. Very light weight, maneuverable, no mixing gas, and pulling to start. Ready whenever I wanted it. The largest "trunks" were about 5". no problem. It would have taken me days without it. I have owned gas powered chain saws. This is so much better. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY SAW
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY SAW. I am a 71 year old petite female and this saw is wonderful. It is easy for me to manage and it enables me to keep bushes and trees trimmed on my property.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Lafferty

customer_reviews.title: Green works 10” bar electric saw - a must for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts well. Be sure to loosen the chain to proper looseness, charge battery to full charge and add oil. I cut a 6” tree slice in about 2.5 minutes and cut up a 10” dead tree in about14 minutes. My Stihl 16” Farm boss would Completer the 10” tree in less than a minute but that’s a professional gas saw at 4 times the price of the Greeworks saw. Definitely a great chagrin saw for around the house or backpacking and trail clearing that I use it for. The 10” tree used 2/3rds of the batter charge.
customer_reviews.author: R. Joseph Jalbert

customer_reviews.title: Missing a screw?
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until the chain started falling off. I think it is missing a screw. Can anyone that has one please look at the photo I attached where I drew the orange circle and tell me if there is supposed to be a screw there? I really haven't used this that much and it looks to me like a screw has fallen out. It seems like if there was a cap screw there it would for a pivot for the adjustment screw but without it the chain is too loose. I've adjusted it but then it doesn't stay.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie L. Granger

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for several weeks and love it. I debated whether to get this saw ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several weeks and love it. I debated whether to get this saw or a similar 10" Black and Decker without the self oiling feature which was slightly less expensive. DH talked me into getting this one, and I have no regrets. I've used to cut Pride of Madeira (hard dry wood), acacias and melaleuca up to 6" across. No problems. It's quiet, holds a charge longer than I do and has made my life a lot easier. The light weight is nice for someone who's never handled a chainsaw before.
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It works good. It has some kick back when cutting the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works good. It has some kick back when cutting the wood, which I didn't have on my previous chainsaw. I is light and get the job done. Battery last for few hours, which is good because then you can finally take a break. If you want to charge the battery right away, it will show that it's too hot to be charged. So your break will be little bit longer to wait until the battery cools down first and then you can charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Rothany Kubis

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw !
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lightweight chain saw, as a lot of my property is overgrown and needed trimming. I love this chainsaw. It is so lightweight and maneuverable. Using a chain saw can seem intimidating, but the ease of using this saw is great. I feel confident that I can use it safely and get the job done. Like some of the other reviewers, I am an older woman, and felt fine using this saw. I liked that it ran on a battery. no need to mess with a gas can, and it runs clean. I have cut down small trees, and fallen logs as big as 10 and 1/2 inches with this saw. Love it ~~
customer_reviews.author: Christy M

customer_reviews.title: Another tool from Green works
customer_reviews.text: I have other 24 volt greenworks tools so this chainsaw without battery was a bargain. I've only used it one time but I'l impressed with this little cutter. I carry this in my truck, great for camp fire wood, clearing wind fall on less traveled roads. Battery holds charge for about 10-12 months in storage. Good run time.
customer_reviews.author: Claggett's Bengals

customer_reviews.title: Great, Lightweight, Power Efficient, Easy-Use Portable Electric Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by this portable electric chainsaw. Lightweight and well-balanced. Easy to start and use, and very quiet - no hearing protection needed. Bar oil indicator very visible and easy to read. Chain tension knob easily accessible and to use. Battery charged in few hours and lasted through cutting up & trimming large evergreen tree limb (9" diameter) with power left over (1 hour work). My wife (we're in our 70s), unfamiliar with chainsaws, had no problem using it cutting through an 8" diameter part of the limb and was looking for more things to cut. Highly recommended for a lightweight, portable electric saw.
customer_reviews.author: RMLANN

customer_reviews.title: This saw cuts great for light duty projects
customer_reviews.text: This saw cuts great for light duty projects. I used it to trim my palm trees and it worked well except for the chain coming off 3 times! When you are on a ladder up 34’ it’s a pain in the ass! Pros: Light weight Cuts well Easy to adjust Cons: No matter what I did the chain consistently popped off Not sure: Battery life Durability
customer_reviews.author: Vincent A DePaepe

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Last week after another storm, once again my old gas powered chain saw failed to run properly....again. I broke down and went over to the dark side: Battery Power! I can't vouch for the battery life but after 20 minutes in the yard this saw easily got through a downed peach tree (about 8 inches in diameter) and quickly made mince meat of another fallen pine. Didn't have to futz around with the pull start on the gas saw...didn't throw out my shoulder trying to start the gas saw and my wife and kids didn't have to hear me cursing in the yard. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lund

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chain saw. I've been able to limb up, cut down, and reduce trees and branches for hauling. It holds a charge for a long time, recharges quickly, is easy to handle, and cuts through surprisingly larger items than I had anticipated. I couldn't be happier with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: 30 min battery, great little chainsaw.lightweight too.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I use it to clean up my yard. We have 5 acres of woods trying to take over our little yard. Trees fall down frequently and I use this little guy to slice through most of the wood. I leave the big stuff for my husband and our gas 18 inch chainsaw. The battery only lasts about 30 min. Long enough for me to feel productive. My husband wishes I would have gotten the bigger battery, but I love it. It is really nice for keeping my yard tidy.
customer_reviews.author: L Weber

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase for me
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about a battery operated chainsaw. I am an owner of a tree company and needed a chainsaw asap. Purchased this one and I must say it has not let me down. I have put it behind the truck seat and used it on 6 properties so far and no issues. Cuts through anything. I can see where I could use my has saws on huge trees. If you have small stuff to do around the yard you will not be distracted.
customer_reviews.author: BigChief

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light-weight occasional use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a family friend (73 year old lady) who loves gardening, and needed something to prune limbs off bushes and small trees around her California property (wild fire safety!). This was perfect for her: the 7.5 lb weight was easily managed for short term use (10-15 limbs each use), easy to start and shut off, easy to lubricate chain (self lubricating), and (in her words) cool looking. Works well, charges easily, and easy to handle. Only had it a month or so. No issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: SC99

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little chainsaw. Purchased for my husbands birthday and he’s in love. Uses it to take in the woods on rides and to trim around tree stands . Very light weight. Easy to use. Long life battery. We were able to cut a pretty large tree down with a few cuts without it ever slowing down. Does amazing for a battery operated chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a battery operated saw
customer_reviews.text: I used this to remove a 10ft fallen pine from my yard. I didn't count the number of cuts but it got me through the job on a single charge. It would not be suitable for multiple jobs but it surprised me at how easy it cut everything and without the noise. It does use up a lot of oil so make sure you buy a large bottle because you'll be refilling it with each charge. Oh and tighten the chain before using it. It did pop off on me because I didn't make sure it was tightened.
customer_reviews.author: EDURP

customer_reviews.title: Battery Operated Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible. I love this little chainsaw for my small projects. Works well, easy to fix the chain, top off the oil reservoir, etc. Easy to keep clean also. I wish the battery lasted a little longer but I am still satisfied with my purchase. Good job Greenworks! (I am elderly and needed a chainsaw to keep up with my lawn projects and gardening. This fits great with my needs to keep my tree branches at bay?.
customer_reviews.author: Elviskindofgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kimo chainsaw to trim my trees in the backyard. It is a small but powerful little chainsaw. I can use it with one hand, and the chain is super easy to tighten without the use of any tools. I trimmed all the tree's in my backyard and the battery is still going strong. If you need a small chainsaw that doesn't use gas, is cordless, and doesn't need a toolbox to tighten the chain you can't go wrong with this one. I would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Tomecko

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: As a old lady that’s logs are loo big for the stove, this little saw is a beast. I have been saving the pieces that were too long all winter. Not really sure how many cuts I made, but it was still going strong. I highly recommend this 10 inch saw. I’m just afraid that my husband is going to barrow it and I’ll never see it again.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Not that thrilled, sorry
customer_reviews.text: It's ok...but it struggles with anything over 4 inches...I was disappointed because my Home-lite ''electric corded'' buzzes right through the same log in half the time...and its 8 years old....i just wanted the convenience of a '''cordless''' and the GreenWorks hedge trimmer is a workhorse...but this chainsaw? ...not so much...p.s----for the price, it should come with ''2'' batteries
customer_reviews.author: pdxWildChild

customer_reviews.title: Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: My daughter made me return the item as she said," What is a 75 year old woman doing with a chain saw." Sorry, I can't be of more help. It looked great in the box. Everything was there and the delivery was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Great small easy to use chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Great small easy to use chain saw. Love it. Battery runs out about the same time I do. 70 years old and still going strong only slower.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for light work, we have trees with extremely thick (like my arm or bigger) English Ivy that is a nuisance to try to saw off. This thing cuts through it like a knife through butter. It is light and very maneuverable. I wouldn't use it to take down large oaks, but gather it does well with decent size logs. I thought about getting the next size up, but so far haven't felt the need.
customer_reviews.author: FencerFrank

customer_reviews.title: All one needs for trimming tree limbs.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that was light and easy to handle to trim tree limbs and take down small trees on a three acre property. This Greenworks 10 inch worked better than expected and the battery life was right on point for my needs. Just know that you will need to supply your own Bar Oil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good saw for light use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to use as a trail cutting saw to cut small trees & limbs. It does a very good job of that. The battery doesn't last very long & maybe for 2 hours at time, but it does charge up very fast. The bar oiler quit working for a bit, but I think it was clogged up with sawdust. I cleaned it & works fine. The chain is a bit small & narrow, but works fine for pruning & limb cutting. This saw by no means will cut your firewood for the winter. Use a bigger Stihl/Husqvarna/Echo for that. As long as you keep it oiled, sharpened, & charged this saw will do small jobs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: mdRazz

customer_reviews.title: Saw is very light and perfect for handling smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: Saw is very light and perfect for handling smaller jobs. I even went through a 6" dia. stump of a juniper. Recharging battery takes a bit over an hour. If you are in a hurrr, get two batteries. Customer service on product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: misanthrope01

customer_reviews.title: Great saw; great value!!
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is a winner. The battery lasts longer than expected. Be sure to keep the manual because you will need it if the chain comes off. This is easily prevented by keeping the chain tension adjusted. It is a great limb trim saw. You need to check the chain oil often. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbit

customer_reviews.title: Decent little saw for light work.
customer_reviews.text: This works well, but be warned that it slings oil on you while using. It also tends to leak oil while stored. Additionally, it throws the chain a lot when cutting, especially on larger branches. But the chain is relatively easy to put back on. Still, it is a bit of a pain to have to do it. This is a very light duty saw, but perfect for light pruning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: A big surprise in a small package
customer_reviews.text: This little bad boy really doesn't know it's size. I can fell a sizeable 12 inch tree in stages when used right. Chain only slipped off once and was easy to reset
customer_reviews.author: N. Mcphee

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: I primarily purchase this for camping trips .The picture is of last years Christmas trees and some branches I trimmed last season. This little saw was perfect for the small stuff 4" and smaller, it cut smooth and had plenty of power . I have a Greenworks 40v Lawn mower their products and great
customer_reviews.author: wesley gaines

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw has met my needs very well. It is lightweight, yet easily cuts through the small 1" - 4" diameter trees I wanted to cut out of that little no man's land between the garage and the fence. It is easy to use, and the battery hasn't run out yet while I was using it. If I was trying to cut larger branches or trees, I'd want a bigger version.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been very impressed with this chainsaw. I used it for about 1 1/2 hr the first time. It is lite, easy to use and cuts through all the limbs I needed to cut. The only complaint I have is taking the battery out of the saw, it feels as though it does not want to exit, even after pushing the release button. I would recommend this saw to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E. Blunden

customer_reviews.title: seems dumb to pay the same price for one more battery
customer_reviews.text: Decent saw, need another battery however; seems dumb to pay the same price for one more battery. Will buy another kind just for the battery. Cuts well especially after I removed the pullback bar to start the saw. The bar was too sensitive and stopped the saw too much. Easy adjustment, no tools required. One handed sawing possible.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Grove

customer_reviews.title: Great products
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this chainsaw,because I'll climb a tree to trim the smaller branches,and don't have worry about cranking saw to start.I haven't used it to long of day,but time used has been for personal use.I'll give it a 4 because i wish that when you remove battery and place in the lower compartment,it just slides out.Where if for safety,while climbing you can store there.or even have a second battery.Thank you for another great greenworks products,battery interchangeable with drill/driver
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Vega

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for my needs. Wish it were little lighter but ok.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: It was a great price and works well on the small limbs i wanted to cut. However the battery life is only about 20 minutes of on and off cutting. I believe the manual stated approximately 40 minutes. So falls short. I will buy a bigger battery when I find one on sale
customer_reviews.author: George Mcmurphy

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this chain saw. It really holds a charge . He has done the initial charge and said after cutting lots of branches from trees that it still shows he has only used a third of the charge.. he loves it. Very easy to use . No cord or gas to worry with
customer_reviews.author: Dutch J

customer_reviews.title: Used three Times - Snapped in half
customer_reviews.text: If you are using the unit to cut down a very thin brush or branch you should be just fine. The three times I used it I really liked it. Battery life was never an issues. The chain was very hard to maintain tension, however readjusting was very easy. This afternoon, the chain became out of tension, slipped off the guides , got jammed in the rear sprocket and twisted the entire unit in half. I'm not sure what I could have done any different and given the opportunity of replacement, I'm not positive I'd want it. Sorry Greenworks, maybe I got the one in a million that had a defect. I've owned other Greenworks products without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble getting my gas saw started so explored the whole electric thing. Only had a small job to do so decided to give this saw a chance for under a hundred bucks. Worked great for trimming cherry trees which is why I bought it, so well in fact that I thought what the heck give it a try on three dead trees on the edge of property. These are real trees 30 foot high or so and 8 to 10 inches around and this little saw ate right through them. Very impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: gary grant

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this thinking for my husband thinking we may need to return since it's so small, but it powers through limbs and dead trees like his previous larger gas powered model and this is run off a shared tool 20v battery - a GREAT VALUE. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Take2

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing won't even cut through a shrub limb 1/2 an inch. I would cut around the edges of the limb to give me an indentation and then break off the limb. I was very disappointed. Fortunately the seller was excellent about my return and money back.
customer_reviews.author: lparisss

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, easy to use, non intimidating to those who have never used a chainsaw. Small enough for a petite woman to use. Won’t take down a sequoia but works for smaller trees. Battery life sucks, but if your not in any hurry it’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mohler

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me
customer_reviews.text: Was an Amazon "out of the box" chainsaw and had an issue with a defective battery charger but Greenworks took care of it in a timely fashion. I am a 70+ yr. old female and this lightweight chainsaw is perfect for me cutting kindling for my wood stove and will probably be great for some branches in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jo.

customer_reviews.title: No Tools Needed
customer_reviews.text: We love this little chainsaw. It feels so much safer than a gas or electric. It does a fantastic job of trimming and cut small limbs. We cut some the size of six inches and it went right thru them. The battery lasted longer than I did. Very happy with this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Nancy V. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: lumber jack in training
customer_reviews.text: this thing works amazing! I might even turn into a lumber jack before you know it!! Cuts all sorts of small trees growing g around d my chain link fence and cuts brush up to go into the yard waste bin. This saw works very nicely
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband unfortunately he didn't actually use it before the 30 day return, He hates it. Says it won't even cut small tree branches with out using a lot of force to press down. He loved the weight but it won't cut.
customer_reviews.author: Sg47

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw that will do exactly as they say it well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little chainsaw I highly recommend it. But the battery life will necessarily let you go for a long time it does a great job right up till the end. Super easy to maneuver and that just makes the job so much safer. Lightweight materials but not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: and it worked great for about 3 hours
customer_reviews.text: My husband was so excited to get this, and it worked great for about 3 hours. Now, it will not charge. Light on charger stays red. I would think that we should be sent new battery and charger.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Odom

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is very disappointing !!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using battery operated tools for decades. Since the day they first came out. This 24v battery is not worth the time it took to manufacture. Very poor performance. Lasted maybe 15 minutes before needing to be recharged. Possibly a lemon, however past the warranty date and I’ll not be spending $70-$80 for more junk. Lesson learned 80v is only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Cali-kaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A great chainsaw for small to medium jobs
customer_reviews.text: Actually, this saw was for my brother. He loves it. I've had one for over 4 years and it is great! When my 20" Stihl Farm Boss is too much for the job, I just grab my Greenworks saw and get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: ILANDMON

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is absolutely amazing! I am a small woman and I was scared at first but it is easy as can be! Light weight and works so quickly! Cuts through a 4 inch branch within seconds!! My yardwork got done almost instantly. Wish I would have bought this years ago...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Falch

customer_reviews.title: Great for it's size
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw if needed only for extremely light work. The blade, as mentioned in the description, is pretty short. Still, I managed to trim a bunch of tree limbs in my backyard, and the charge lasts a good length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Timm Davison

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the speed of cutting and the battery life. I'm sure more expensive saws costing $200 or more would outperform this one, but for the price, I don't think it can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Shinall

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for below 100$. Easy to use and good enough for cutting medium to small jobs. I didn’t get this to cut down large tree. Not using it for professional jobs. Convenient and easy to use. Something I will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: White Lantern

customer_reviews.title: OK for trimming and pruning
customer_reviews.text: Not particularly speedy, but it's battery-operated, relatively lightweight. You're not going to be felling trees or cutting firewood--but it's OK for pruning, bucking small limbs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Hy D. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Chain pops out every minute
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review on first day i received the chainsaw when i tried it on a small tree. I recommended it as the best for homeowners. I tried it few weeks ago and the chain keep getting out of the saw. I had to open the case and reset it again and I had to do that zillion times. I don't know what's happening but I don't think i'll have unlimited amount of patience to keep doing this.
customer_reviews.author: V. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today to cut up branches that fell in my yard The largest cut I made was on a 4 in piece Great weight for this old man to carry around a battery last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Mendota

customer_reviews.title: Thought I’d won the lottery!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! If I lost it would but another immediately. I have had 2 shoulder replacements and often find it impossible to pull start tools. 66 yr old woman clearing A LOT of small stuff on 4 acres on hilly wooded acreage. Works great! Easy to handle. Love my little chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dickey

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: This saw has plenty of power for cutting wood up to about 10" diameter. Recharge is fast. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: tuck0355

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: I am 72 and can handle this with ease. That being said, I've twisted it while cutting and got the chain caught. I just need to be conscious of keeping it straight while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: NonMechanic

customer_reviews.title: Does not make a clean cut
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on lower hanging tree branches but it was difficult to cut through them and other things I tried to use it for. I will be returning this item. I cant speak to the battery life since I only tried it once, but it was light weight and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Tough little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I love my little chainsaw. I am a 56 year old woman and I use the heck out of it trimming away limbs and cutting down little trees that sprout up. I am amazed at how tough it is and how long the battery last. I am definitely buying more Greenworks machines.
customer_reviews.author: D. Olive

customer_reviews.title: Good little chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: So this little guy has cut down about a cord of wood for me!! It took about 5 charges but it cut down small 5-7 inch trees and their limbs with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with performance. Batteries last a long time, (did buy a second battery to keep things moving along) easy to maintain, cuts well, lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Serant

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first battery powered chain saw and I love it! Just right for smaller jobs. No more mixing oil and yanking a cord. Lots of power and I filled my 1/2 ton pickup to the roof with saplings and branches three times before having to charge the battery. I love that you can adjust the tension on the chain with just a turn of the knob. This is a great little saw!
customer_reviews.author: Christie Nakaganeku

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive portable battery power chainsaw that is great for around the yard
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive portable battery power chainsaw that is great for around the yard. Make sure to buy the related bar oil as that is a must and none is included
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kick back and chain keeps falling off
customer_reviews.text: Why does the chain keep falling off??? It comes off, I have to set it back on track, set tension, yet, keeps coming off track but not before it starts kicking back. HELP!!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with a new item
customer_reviews.text: Chain kept popping off. Returned the item and bought corded unit with longer blade at one third the cost. Very happy with a new item.
customer_reviews.author: Sdlee

customer_reviews.title: Interchangeable battery
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I used my weedeater to edge the lawn, put the oil in the chainsaw took the battery out of the weedeater and put it in the chainsaw and used the chainsaw to chop down and cut up a small tree. The battery was used about an hour with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: AngusJack

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: it is perfect for cutting suckers on tree trunks and trimming limbs, the battery lasted over an hour on a charge, not constant running but on and off use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small jobs. It is quiet compared to a gas powered chainsaw. For basic pruning or taking down small trees this works well. If you want to use it for more than an hour then I would recommend having two batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Scott1209

customer_reviews.title: Saw works great battery doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: beware the battery doesn't last as long as the should I bought it from Amazon warehouse the Box was open but the unit was never used the battery supposed have a 2 year warranty they would not give me the warranty because it was an Open Box there's only a 90 day warranty and that beware
customer_reviews.author: steffieschu

customer_reviews.title: You can do better
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended for more than trimming twigs. Better off with a 16-14" electric or gas for anything over1" in diameter. Charger and 24V battery good, but if you maintain any amount of farm-type property, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K

customer_reviews.title: Too bad because it seemed like a great saw
customer_reviews.text: Returning it due to the chain coming off a lot. Too bad because it seemed like a great saw.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bob

customer_reviews.title: Someone will probably make fun but it works
customer_reviews.text: It has performed amazingly sounds like a battery powered tonka truck but i fell 3 trees about 7inches in diameter in roughly 20 minutes and the battery was done
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviews

customer_reviews.title: Mean green machine
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the power this little cordless chainsaw has!! I have cut down a couple of trees 12" wide and it still had battery juice to spare. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This chainsaw was just what I needed for thinning out ...
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw was just what I needed for thinning out a stand of hibiscus. It definitely drips oil, so watch out where you set it down or clean it.
customer_reviews.author: N.B.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Did not know what to expect at 24V. This saw is so easy to use and can cut approx. 10, 8" to 12" limbs before needing charging. Great for around the yard. Beats dragging around a heavy gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight yet powerful
customer_reviews.text: Not very heavy, yet powerful. Lost lasting battery and gets the job done! Love it
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Carson

customer_reviews.title: NO BAR AND CHAIN OIL INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: NO BAR AND CHAIN OIL INCLUDED WITH THE SAW. NOW I HAVE TO MAKE A TRIP TO THE STORE. VERY AGGRAVATING!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Fisher

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, cuts quickly
customer_reviews.text: excellent battery life, lightweight and easy to handle. Cuts nice and no cord to pull.
customer_reviews.author: lunker

customer_reviews.title: It's a cheap saw
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to run ok, but, has a lot of problems when it comes to keeping the chain on. You can make 2 or 3 cuts, and the chain comes off.
customer_reviews.author: richard williams

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap saw.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do some light trimming on my three acres. Didn't want the hassle of maintaining a gas engine saw that may only get 1-2 hours use a year. Works fine for what I use it for, got about three hours on it now and no worry's.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Porter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  The little saw that could
customer_reviews.text: I have several Greenworks tools. They are better than all the others I've owned. I'll buy more as needed
customer_reviews.author: Robert F> Beaudin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the small things I need to cut around my property. If it is too small for the job I shouldn't be doing it.
customer_reviews.author: jr111

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Very good for small jobs in garden, battery is been charged very fast, so you don't need extra one. Great stuff for beginners
customer_reviews.author: George Qartvel

customer_reviews.title: cleaning
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that under the chain, all woos and leafs get stuck there, it does not cut anything larger then 2-3 inches
customer_reviews.author: Zoda

customer_reviews.title: Terrific deal
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected, lightweight and charge lasts for quite some time. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get yourself one!
customer_reviews.text: Will be using it to cut up it at our cottage and have used it R home.
customer_reviews.author: Dr robert p jacobson sr PhD

product_meta.title: Greenworks 10-Inch 24V Cordless Chainsaw, 2.0 AH Battery Included 20362
product_meta.description: Size:2Ah Battery IncludedGreenWorks G-24 System offers versatility with a range of tools to choose from to get the job done with outdoor and indoor tools for all your DIY Projects. Whether it is getting the deck completed or getting your yard in pristine shape, the G-24 System has a tool for every project. From trimmers, chainsaw, pole saw and sweepers to drills, compressors and handheld circular saws, this system is quickly becoming the most versatile system for the suburban home. Compatible Battery and Charger Models include, Model 29842 and 29862. All GreenWorks Tools are backed with a 4 year warranty, the lithium-ion batteries are backed with a 2 year warranty. GreenWorks 20362 G24 Lithium-ion 10 inch Chainsaw includes 2.0AH Li-Ion Battery and Charger.
feature_bullets: 24V Lithium-Ion Battery compatible with both indoor and outdoor tools, 2AH battery and charger included
10-Inch bar and chain, perfect for cutting branches and limbs with ease
Tool-less chain tensioning for quick adjustments so you can get back to the task at hand
Automatic oiler applies oil to the arm and chain to ensure durability and extend the life of the chain
Translucent oil tank for clear view of oil level

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars490 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
